column4: I just reinstalled Ubuntu Hoary..how do I get my bittorrent to work?
can anyone help me with getting Gnome bittorrent to work?
whenever I try to download the torrent file it says timeout exceeded
easy. dont use it
install bittorrent instead
System > Admin > synaptic (it's a wonderful program. you'll like it)
a .sh file is a "shell script" . it is executed by the shell (synonymous with a windows batch file)
writing to ntfs from linux is a good first step to an all linux system
you run windows
you can read from the ntfs partition all you like
it is in your /media directory
you really should read the link ubotu sent you
you really should get some terminal basics under your belt (cuz you could wreck something <like your NTFS partition>)
yes, but no data will be left over
you realize you could destroy your NTFS partition that way, right?
then why not convert the partition to ext3?
ah Dr. Frankenstein
we dont recommend it
writing to NTFS (even with captive) can kill the rest off
of course it does
check you memory with memtest
one of your boot options should be memtest, or d/l the iso from ubcd.sourceforge.net
tars?>
follow the links
